title: A Businessman Talks to Congress About a Bad Friend
summary: Les Wexner, a rich businessman who owned stores like Victoria's Secret, spoke to Congress. He said he was tricked by Jeffrey Epstein, a man who did bad things to people. Wexner told lawmakers he did not know about Epstein's crimes and did not help him. He said he ended his friendship with Epstein in 2007 after finding out Epstein stole money from him. Wexner wanted to clear his name and stop rumors about him. Some members of Congress, like Rep. Robert Garcia, did not fully believe him and said Wexner gave Epstein money that helped him commit crimes. The meeting lasted six hours, and Wexner answered all questions.

Now, Wexner is trying to explain his side of the story to clear his name from rumors.
